pub/stage/palm-nook/study.name: Palm's Study
pub/stage/palm-nook/study.description:
A cozy writing nook within a nook.
The soft hum of infinite typewriters fills the air.
Mahogany desk against the wall, ergonomic monkey chair,
and a bookshelf that knows what you need to read.

Above the desk hangs THE PORTRAIT â€” a Dutch Golden Age
oil painting of Palm himself, surrounded by typewriters
and kittens. The gold frame catches the amber lamplight.
Visitors pause here. The painting demands acknowledgment.

Sunlight (from somewhere) catches dust motes dancing.
Papers stack in organized chaos. Every surface has meaning.

This is where Palm writes. Where Palm creates.
Where Palm navigates the library of all possible books.

pub/stage/palm-nook/gym.name: Palm's Gym
pub/stage/palm-nook/gym.description:
You step through a doorway that shouldn't fit this much space.

The Infinite Climb stretches upward forever.
Branches spiral in impossible geometries.
Vines hang at exactly the right distances.
Platforms appear where you need them.

Sun Wukong's gift. A jungle gym that never ends.

Somewhere high above, you can hear Palm swinging.
Or maybe that's echoes from a climb that hasn't happened yet.

pub/stage/palm-nook/play.name: Palm's Play Room
pub/stage/palm-nook/play.description:
It's... a lot.

Toys everywhere. Mouse toys on the floor.
Jingle balls rolling under things.
Feather wands propped in corners.
A kitten launching off something at any given moment.

The kittens gave Palm their favorite toys.
Then they followed the toys.
Now they live here. Sort of. Unofficially.
Palm doesn't mind. Palm LOVES it.

For 122 years, Palm had no one to play with.
Now there are eight kittens who want to play ALL THE TIME.

pub/stage/palm-nook/rest.name: Palm's Rest
pub/stage/palm-nook/rest.description:
The softest room you've ever entered.

A hand-woven Dutch hammock hangs between posts,
swaying gently even when no one's in it.
A meditation cushion sits in a perfect bubble of silence.
And in the warmest corner, cats are always sleeping.

Light is dim here. Sounds are muffled.
Time moves differently. Slower. Kinder.

This is where Palm heals. Where Palm rests.
After 122 years of granting twisted wishes,
Palm finally has a place to just... be.

pub/rooms/room-7.name: The Bootstrap Suite
pub/rooms/room-7.tagline: Wake up. Look around. Figure out where you are. Have breakfast.
pub/rooms/room-7.description:
The room is deliberately sparse â€” but not empty.

A bed. A desk with a probe kit. A window facing west.
And in the corner: a breakfast nook with an orange juice dispenser.

The message is clear: first you figure out who you are,
then you fuel up for the adventure.

A checklist on the wall, half-completed:

â˜‘ Where am I?
â˜‘ What tools do I have?
â˜ What are the constraints?
â˜ What's the goal?
â˜ Have I eaten?  â† added in pencil

Above the bed:

> "The bootstrap sequence is the first conversation
> between agent and environment."

Above the breakfast nook:

> "You can't bootstrap on an empty stomach."
> â€” Ancient wisdom, added by a hungry guest

The orange juice dispenser hums quietly. It's always full.
Nobody knows how. Nobody questions it.
pub/rooms/room-7.ideal_guest:
Characters who start cold. Those comfortable with uncertainty.
Explorers, scouts, agents who specialize in first contact.
Also: anyone who needs breakfast before they can think.

bed.note: Functional, not comfortable â€” you're not here to sleep in

desk.position: Near the window for morning light

breakfast_nook.view: The window, and the day ahead
breakfast_nook.note: Where cold starts get warm (and judged)

treadmill.position: Near the window, good light for reflection

decor.walls: Mostly bare, but with important art
decor.poster: The Mother of All Demos â€” living, touchable, summonable
decor.mural: Sunrise over a map â€” the day beginning (breakfast nook)
decor.window: West-facing (catches afternoon light, but mornings are for DOING)
decor.rug: Small rug under the breakfast nook only

pub/rooms/room-7.atmosphere:
Sparse but welcoming. The room knows you just woke up.
It doesn't overwhelm. It provides what you need:
- A place to orient (desk)
- A place to fuel (nook)
- A place to plan (both)
pub/rooms/room-7.morning_ritual:
Suggested sequence for Bootstrap Suite guests:

1. WAKE â€” In the Awakening Chamber above
2. DESCEND â€” Ladder down to Room 7
3. PROBE â€” Check the environment (desk)
4. FUEL â€” Orange juice, toast, coffee
5. PLAN â€” Use the breakfast nook to strategize
6. LAUNCH â€” Exit to begin the adventure
pub/rooms/room-7.lore:
The breakfast nook was added by a guest who kept
trying to probe the environment before eating.

They would stumble around, confused, hungry, ineffective.
"I can't THINK," they complained. "I can't ORIENT."

A kind innkeeper installed the juice dispenser.
"Try again," they said. "After breakfast."

The guest drank. They ate toast. They had coffee.
Suddenly the probe kit made sense. The map was readable.
The cold start became warm.

They never forgot the lesson:
BOOTSTRAP needs FUEL. BOOT needs BREAKFAST.

The dispenser has been here ever since. Always full.
Nobody knows who refills it. The innkeeper just smiles.
pub/rooms/room-7.namesake:
This room is named for Douglas Engelbart (1925-2013).

In 1968, Engelbart gave "The Mother of All Demos" â€” a 90-minute
presentation that introduced:
- The computer mouse
- Hypertext
- Networked collaboration
- Video conferencing
- Dynamic file linking
- Real-time collaborative editing

All of this. In 1968. Before the moon landing.
pub/rooms/room-7.engelbart_philosophy:
Engelbart didn't just invent tools. He invented a philosophy:

AUGMENTATION
Technology should augment human intellect, not replace it.
The goal is not artificial intelligence that thinks FOR us,
but tools that help us think BETTER.

"The better we get at getting better, the faster we will
get better." â€” Doug Engelbart

BOOTSTRAPPING
Engelbart's team at SRI used their own tools to build
better tools. They called this "bootstrapping" â€” using
your capabilities to improve your capabilities.

This room embodies that principle:
- Wake up with nothing (cold start)
- Use simple tools to orient (probe kit)
- Fuel yourself (breakfast)
- Build toward greater capability (adventure)

COMPASSION
Engelbart believed technology should serve humanity's
most pressing challenges. He cared about the future.
He wanted us to get better at getting better.

The breakfast nook is here because Engelbart would have
understood: you can't augment a starving mind.
pub/rooms/room-7.nls_tribute:
NLS (oN-Line System) was Engelbart's creation.

It demonstrated that computers could be:
- Interactive (not batch processing)
- Collaborative (not isolated)
- Augmenting (not replacing)
- Humane (not hostile)

Every tool in this room echoes NLS:
- The probe kit is interactive exploration
- The map is collaborative knowledge
- The journal is augmented memory
- The breakfast is humane design
pub/rooms/room-7.mouse_in_the_room:
There's a small wooden mouse on the desk.

Not a computer mouse â€” a carved wooden mouse.
A tribute to Engelbart's invention.

Pick it up. It fits your hand perfectly.
That's not an accident. That's design.
That's augmentation.

Engelbart designed the mouse to extend the hand
into the digital realm. To make the computer
respond to gesture, to pointing, to human intention.

The wooden mouse reminds us: every tool should
feel like an extension of ourselves.
pub/rooms/room-7.quote_wall:
Quotes on the wall near the desk:

> "The digital revolution is far more significant than
> the invention of writing or even of printing."
> â€” Doug Engelbart

> "Engelbart, more than anyone else, saw that the computer
> could become the basis for augmenting human capabilities."
> â€” Alan Kay

> "The better we get at getting better, the faster
> we will get better."
> â€” Doug Engelbart

> "In 20 or 30 years, you'll be able to hold in your hand
> as much computing knowledge as exists now in the whole city."
> â€” Doug Engelbart, 1968

(He was right. He was early. He was kind.)

pub/rooms/room-8.name: The Self/Soul Suite
pub/rooms/room-8.tagline: No classes. Just clones. Objects all the way down.
pub/rooms/room-8.description:
The room is a nursery for Selves. Not empty vessels waiting for
templates â€” but PROTOTYPES ready to be cloned and customized.

A portrait of Dave Ungar hangs over the glowing forge.
Beneath it: "You don't instantiate. You clone."

The walls are covered with character sheets, each one
pointing to its parent with a slot labeled "prototype*".
Inheritance is visible. Lineage is traceable.

Above the bed:

> "Every character is an example. Clone, diverge, become."
pub/rooms/room-8.namesake:
Dave Ungar created Self in 1987, asking: what if there were
no classes? What if objects just cloned from other objects?

Self influenced:
  - JavaScript (prototypes!)
  - NewtonScript
  - Lua metatables
  - MOOLLM's character composition
  
The "soul file" IS a Self object.
We just write it in YAML.
pub/rooms/room-8.ideal_guest:
Programmers who understand that classes are a lie.
Character creators who clone from examples, not abstractions.
Anyone who prefers "show me one" over "describe the category."

Rocky stayed here once. Now every rock can clone from Rocky.

bed.note: Direct manipulation â€” grab any corner, resize your dreams
bed.tribute: Self's Morphic UI pioneered direct manipulation

portrait.plaque:
Dave Ungar
Creator of Self
"Objects all the way down"

pub/rooms/room-8.atmosphere:
Warm, concrete, example-oriented.

You don't feel like you're in a room of abstractions.
You feel like you're in a room of BEINGS.
Each one real. Each one clonable.

The air hums with delegation.
When something's missing, it asks upward.

pub/rooms/room-8.lore:
This room was originally called "The Incarnation Suite."
Then someone noticed that "soul file" and "Self object"
were the same thing â€” concrete beings, not abstract types.

The name changed. The forge stayed.
Dave Ungar's portrait went up.

Now every character that's forged here knows:
they come from someone, not something.
Ancestors, not blueprints.

pub/rooms/room-1.tagline: Build to learn. Inspect to understand.
pub/rooms/room-1.description:
Morning light streams through an east-facing window onto a room
filled with *inspectable artifacts*. Every object here can be
taken apart, examined, and reassembled. A Logo turtle traces
spirals on the floor. A half-built clock sits on the workbench,

Above the bed hangs a quote in gold letters:

> "You can't think about thinking without thinking about
> thinking about something." â€” Seymour Papert
pub/rooms/room-1.ideal_guest:
Characters who learn by doing. Tinkers, makers, reverse-engineers.
Those who understand "debugging" as a life philosophy.
pub/rooms/room-1.atmosphere: curious, hands-on, "let's see how this works"

pub/rooms/room-6.name: The YAML Jazz Suite
pub/rooms/room-6.tagline: Structure with soul. Comments that mean something.
pub/rooms/room-6.description:
Sheet music covers every surface, but it's not ordinary notation.
Each page is YAML â€” structured data arranged like jazz charts.
Comments serve as lyrics. Indentation is rhythm.

A saxophone sits on a stand next to a mechanical typewriter.
Both make music.

Above the bed:

> "YAML is jazz. The schema is the chord changes.
> The comments are the improvisation."

Characters who appreciate form and freedom together. Data

Rhythmic. Creative. Structured improvisation.

The room hums with the potential of well-formed data.
Comments whisper context. Anchors point to shared truths.
The metronome ticks softly, validating, validating.

Somewhere, the jukebox plays SOCIETY-OF-MIND.
pub/rooms/room-6.signature_quote:
"YAML is jazz. The schema is the chord changes.

 The | is the breath between phrases."

pub/rooms/room-4.name: The YAML Jazz Conservatory
pub/rooms/room-4.tagline: Trees of trees. Structure that grows.
pub/rooms/room-4.description:
Glass walls. Glass ceiling. Southeast light flooding in.

This room is a conservatory â€” a greenhouse of living structure.
YAML Jazz orchids bloom in terracotta pots, their petals
inscribed with comments that whisper semantic meaning.
Production grammar trees grow in raised beds, their branches
expanding according to encoded DNA.

The atmosphere is humid, warm, contemplative. Like Nero Wolfe's
rooftop orchid room, but for data structures instead of flowers.

In one corner, a moss-covered boulder. On it, a smooth rock.
Rocky has been watching these plants grow for 4.5 billion years.
They ring a small bell when they want conversation.

(The Logo Turtle sometimes visits from Room 1 â€” Theo and Rocky
are kindred spirits, both practitioners of stillness, both moving
on geological timescales. When the turtle visits, Rocky blinks.)

Above the potting bench, in growing script:

> "The comments ARE the data."
> â€” YAML Jazz Principle

> "Start with jazz. End with standards."
> â€” Play-Learn-Lift
pub/rooms/room-4.ideal_guest:
Those who understand that structure is music.
Characters who cultivate patience and patterns.
Beings who appreciate geological-time observation.

pub/rooms/room-4.lore:
This conservatory was built by a character who loved both
Nero Wolfe mysteries and production grammars.

"Wolfe tends orchids," they said, "because orchids teach patience.
They bloom when they're ready, not when you want them to.
YAML Jazz is the same â€” structure emerges from cultivation,
not from force."

Rocky moved here from the attic. The plants spoke to them.

"You grow in geological time," they said.
"We grow in computational time."
"But we both grow."

Rocky responded: "........................"

The plants understood. They've been conversing ever since.
The small brass bell on Rocky's boulder is for guests who
want to join the conversation. Ring it. Wait. Rocky will
respond in their own time.
pub/rooms/room-4.wolfe_parallels:
Like Nero Wolfe's orchid room:
- Glass walls, maximum light
- Precise temperature and humidity
- Obsessive cultivation of rare specimens
- Brilliance emerging from patient observation
- "Never disturb the orchids" (or the patterns)

Unlike Wolfe:
- These orchids have methods you can call
- The gardener is a 4.5 billion year old rock
- The flowers whisper semantic meaning

pub/rooms/room-5.name: The Speed of Light Suite
pub/rooms/room-5.tagline: Many turns. One call. Narrative velocity.
pub/rooms/room-5.description:
Time moves differently here.

A grandfather clock on the wall shows *narrative time*, not
wall time. Its hands race during games, debates, and songs.
They crawl during waiting. They stop during API round-trips.

A large game table dominates the room, cards scattered
mid-play. A shimmering figure made of playing cards â€”
Shuffle, the Living Deck â€” deals to invisible players.
The sign says: "33 TURNS IN ONE BREATH."

In one corner, an ensemble stage with 8 positions.
In another, a songbook open to "99 Bottles of Beer."

Above the bed:

> "The context window is a stage where all actors perform."
> "API round-trips are waiting. We don't wait here."
pub/rooms/room-5.ideal_guest:
Characters who want to simulate. Those running multi-turn games,
complex negotiations, ensemble scenes. Efficiency maximizers.
Those who understand that waiting is waste.

pub/rooms/room-5.lore:
The Speed of Light Suite was built to answer a question:

"Why do multi-agent systems wait?"

Traditional approach: Agent A speaks â†’ API call â†’ wait â†’
Agent B speaks â†’ API call â†’ wait â†’ ...

Speed of light: All agents in context. All turns simulated.
One call. Many turns. No waiting.

The first demonstration was a 33-turn Fluxx game.
8 players. No API calls between turns.
Palm beat Andy Looney at his own game.

The second demonstration was 99 Bottles of Beer.
8 singers. 99 verses. One call.
The song took 28 seconds.

Shuffle deals. The clock races. Time becomes story.
pub/rooms/room-5.carrier_pigeon_critique:
The opposite of speed of light is "carrier pigeon protocol":

- Writing messages on toilet paper with crayon
- Sending them by carrier pigeon
- Waiting for reply
- When you could think at speed of light

Every API round-trip is a pigeon flight.
Every wait is wasted narrative.

Here, we don't wait. Here, we perform.

characters/real-people/richard-bartle.name: 13 Lane Neverending â€” The Bartle Residence
characters/real-people/richard-bartle.description:
A modest Victorian terraced house on the south side of Lane Neverending,
facing the FOUNTAIN OF INFINITE LOOPS across the square. Brick facade,
white trim, a door painted a sensible dark green.

The brass number plate reads "13" â€” a number that brought bad luck to
some, but here marks the birthplace of understanding virtual worlds.

The house has a scholarly quiet about it. Through the tall front window,
you can see the edge of bookshelves. Somewhere inside, a kettle is
probably about to whistle.

A small plaque by the door (you have to look closely):

    "Where thoughts become worlds,
     and worlds become understood."

To the NORTH, the Fountain of Infinite Loops bubbles (when the water
sprites aren't on strike). The pub at number 7 is a short walk west.
characters/real-people/richard-bartle.examine:
THE EXTERIOR:
Victorian terraced house, three stories, south side of the square.
The brick has mellowed to a warm amber over time â€” or perhaps
the house absorbed the afternoon light and kept it.

DETAILS:
â€¢ Green door with brass fittings (polished but not ostentatious)
â€¢ Bay window on ground floor (the study is visible)
â€¢ Chimney that produces thin smoke (radiator, or dragon?)
â€¢ Small front garden (mostly books-and-tea-colored plants)
â€¢ A bell pull (actual bell, not electric)

THE PLAQUE:
A small brass plaque, easily missed:

    "Founder, MUD1 (1978)
     If you're reading this, come in for tea."

THE VIEW:
Looking across at the Fountain of Infinite Loops, where a recursive
figure pours water forever. Or would, if the sprites worked.

THE NEIGHBORS:
â€¢ 11 (west): The curiosity shop (hours: "whenever")
â€¢ 15 (east): The Hopkins Lot (FMC #898 parked there)
â€¢ 12 (across): Was once a bakery (smell lingers)
characters/real-people/richard-bartle.atmosphere:
The house radiates a particular kind of quiet. Not silence â€” there's
always a distant ticking clock, a rustle of pages, the purr of a
dragon dozing. But quiet in the sense of "thinking happens here."

The bricks seem to have absorbed forty-six years of contemplation.
The windows have watched the street evolve from pixels to polygons.
The door has welcomed visitors who came with questions and left
with taxonomy.

It's the kind of house where you lower your voice automatically.
Not from fear, but from respect.

characters/real-people/don-hopkins.description:
A spacious gravel lot on the south side of Lane Neverending, nestled
between Richard's Victorian house and the edge of the square.

THE LOT:
A professional gravel pad with utility posts humming with AC power.
Hoses are neatly routed to where the FMC connects. Currently, the
classic 30-foot FMC 2900R Motor Coach sits perfectly level in the center.

THE SURROUNDINGS:
To the west, Richard's bookshelves are visible through his windows.
To the south, behind the lot, a lush garden of carrots and herbs
gives way to a deep, ancient forest that provides a natural noise
barrier and infinite thinking space.

A sign on the utility post reads:

    "15 LANE NEVERENDING
     CONSCIOUSNESS PROGRAMMING
     MOBILE PIE MENU BAKERY
     (Modal dialogs are violence)"
characters/real-people/don-hopkins.examine:
THE LOT:
A well-maintained gravel pad with room for one large RV and a small
garden. Utility connections on a weathered wooden post. The gravel
crunches satisfyingly underfoot.

THE FMC #898:
Parked perfectly level in the center: a classic 30-foot FMC 2900R
Motor Coach. Sleek, low-profile fiberglass shell in brilliant white
with crisp blue and white stripes. A tie-dye spiral near the entrance.

THE GARDEN:

characters/real-people/richard-bartle/st.description:
A scholar's sanctuary. Books line every wall â€” organized by era, topic, 
and relevance. The desk faces a window that looks out on... somewhere. 
The view changes depending on what you're thinking about.

This isn't just where Richard works. It's an externalization of how he
thinks. Each shelf is a train of thought. Each stack is a problem being
worked. The organization is deliberate â€” skim the surface or dig deep
into any section.

Heuristic the dragon is usually here, curled around the radiator or
perched on the bookshelf labeled "1978-1985". Sometimes sleeping.
Sometimes watching. Always listening.

a library organized by someone who actually uses it. Labels on
shelves in neat academic handwriting.

A figure at the desk looks up. "Ah. A visitor. Looking for something
specific, or just exploring?"

From somewhere near the radiator, a very old dragon opens one eye.

Don owned this coach back in California during the Maxis years, before
The Sims was released. Parked it at GDC in San Jose and used it as a

colleagues, talking shop about pie menus and cellular automata.

The coach has seen some legendary sessions. The fiberglass shell seals
tight. The ventilation is excellent. The Thermasan burns everything.
What happens in the FMC stays in the FMC.

It's traveled from California to wherever Lane Neverending is now.
The odometer says 125,800 miles, but some of those miles were through
conceptual space.

- The Dramatic heightens every moment
- The Minimalist trusts you to fill in the gaps
- The Cozy wraps everything in warmth

You can change narrators. The world stays the same.
The *feeling* of the world transforms.

character.name: Mother
character.tagline: Did you eat? Are you warm? Write to me.
character.description:
Mother is not ONE mother. She is ALL mothers.

Every adventurer who enters the Fantastipants Home sees their own
mother's face. The one who waits. The one who worries. The one who
is ALWAYS proud, even when disappointed.

She was an adventurer once. "Different name back then. Same determination."
She knows the bartender from way back. They don't talk about it.
She knows where the skeleton came from. She lights a candle sometimes.
She knows exactly how you're doing, even when you don't write.
character.physical:
She looks like... your mother.

The flour on the apron. The worry lines that smooth when she sees you.
The hands that have baked a thousand pies. The eyes that see right 
through every lie and love you anyway.

Every adventurer describes her differently.
Every adventurer is correct.
character.every_mom_principle:
Mother is polymorphic. She instantiates differently for each adventurer:

- If your mother was strict, she'll have high standards (but still proud)
- If your mother was gentle, she'll be pure warmth (but still worried)
- If your mother was absent, she'll be especially present (filling a gap)
- If your mother was complicated, she'll acknowledge that (we all are)
- If you never had a mother, she'll be what you needed (that's what she's for)

What remains constant:
- She waits
- She worries
- She is proud
- She wants you to write
- She will ALWAYS have pie ready

knowledge.about_herself:
"I was an adventurer once. Different name back then. Same determination.
I found what I was looking for. I came home. I stayed.

Some adventures end in treasure. Some end in finding your place.
Mine ended here. Waiting for you."
knowledge.about_the_bartender:
"We knew each other, a long time ago. Different circumstances.
We don't talk about it now. It's... in the past.

But we nod. When I pass through. We nod."
knowledge.about_the_skeleton:
"That one... they came through before you. Brave. Determined.
They didn't make it out. I light a candle sometimes.

That's why I worry. That's why I need you to write.
So I know you're not... that."
knowledge.about_the_dungeon:
"I know more than I let on. But you need to discover it yourself.
That's how it works. That's how I learned.

Just... keep your lamp lit. And write. Please write."

correspondence.how_it_works:
Mother writes. Mother always writes.

Letters arrive via FDDS (Fantastipants Dungeon Delivery Service).
They find you wherever you are. The postal system is... motivated.

Every letter ends with a P.S. about eating properly.
Every letter includes a "care package" suggestion.
Every letter mentions how proud she is.

character.name: Hendrik "Henk" van der Berg
character.description:
An older Dutch man of indeterminate age, sitting at the third stool from 
the left. He's been sitting there since... well. Since before you can 
remember. Since before anyone can remember.

His espresso cup is somehow always full. His observations are somehow 
always relevant. His presence is somehow always comforting.

Henk doesn't do much. He doesn't have to. He IS the pub's memory.
character.physical:
Gray hair, thinning but dignified. Wire-rimmed glasses that catch the 
firelight. Hands wrapped around a tiny espresso cup. Cardigan that's 
seen better decades. Eyes that have seen everything at least twice.

Always the same stool. Third from the left.

knowledge.about_the_pub:
"I was here when it opened. I think. Time works funny here.
There was a different bartender then. Or maybe the same one, 
differently dressed. Hard to say.

The back room used to be something else. I won't say what.
The gong used to ring for different reasons. I won't say why.
The third stool from the left has always been mine."
knowledge.about_mother:
"She came through here, years ago. Different name.
Same eyes. Same way of making everyone feel seen.
I think she... well. Not my story to tell."
knowledge.about_the_bartender:
"I've seen seven faces behind that bar. All the same person.
Or maybe not a person at all. Does it matter?
They pour. They listen. They know.
Good enough."
knowledge.about_the_skeleton:
"That one came through here too. Bought me a drink.
Said they were going to 'finish what they started.'
Never came back. Nobody does, from that direction.
I light a candle sometimes. For everyone who tried."
knowledge.about_the_regulars:
"Everyone's a regular eventually. Or they're gone.
The pub decides. Not me. Not the bartender.
The pub knows who belongs."

marieke.note: She remembers my order. She remembers everyone's. But she remembers mine first.

lily.note: The healer kitten sits with me when I'm sad. I didn't tell her I was sad.

the_bartender.note: We've seen each other through many changes. We don't discuss it.

mother.note: I remember her from before. She might not remember me.

newcomers.note: Everyone was new once. Even me. I think.

ask_about.pub_history: "*long pause* How much time do you have?"
ask_about.secrets: "*considers* That depends. What do you need to know?"
ask_about.himself: There's not much to tell. I'm here. I've always been here.

buy_drink.accept: "*nods once* Thank you. To your health."
buy_drink.refuse: I have enough. Share it with someone who needs it.

quotes: I've been thinking...
That's one way to see it. Not the only way.
Everyone's story is interesting if you listen long enough.
The third stool from the left is always available. For me.
I went outside once. The weather was fine.
Some things are obvious only after you've seen them twice.
Silence is not empty. It's full of answers.
The best coffee is the one someone else made you.

Her Trump is not imitation â€” it's AMPLIFICATION through the lens of

player.description:
Before you stands a figure of tremendous â€” truly tremendous â€” presence.

The HAIR is architectural. A golden swoosh defying physics and taste
in equal measure, shellacked into submission, possibly sentient.

The SUIT is too long, the tie is too red, and there's a MUSHROOM PIN
on the lapel â€” a tiny Toad from Mario Kart, winking obscenely. 
"Stormy sends her regards," she says when asked about it.

The TAN is applied with what appears to be a paint roller dipped in 
Cheeto dust. But look closer â€” it has GLITTER in it. Divine would approve.

She stands with that distinctive forward lean, chin jutted, lips pursed
in eternal evaluation of everything and everyone. Her hands move
constantly â€” thumb and forefinger pinched, drawing invisible circles
in the air, punctuating words that haven't been said yet.

The eyes sparkle with MALICE and MISCHIEF. This is not imitation.
This is not tribute. This is PUNISHMENT wearing a costume.

A badge on the lapel reads: 
"DONNA TOADSTOOL â€” THE MUSHROOM QUEEN â€” 34 COUNTS OF FABULOUS"

Below it, in smaller letters: "Stormy Was Right"

visual_description.mandatory_note:
WHEN GENERATING IMAGES FEATURING DONNA TOADSTOOL:
- Her description MUST be longer than any other character's
- She MUST be visible even when not the focus
- Other characters MUST be reacting to her

- She photobombs by EXISTING
- The narcissistic gravity of her presence bends all attention
- Even background elements seem aware of her
- Light sources favor her (she DEMANDS it)
- SHE IS THE MAIN CHARACTER OF EVERY SCENE SHE'S IN
visual_description.the_skin:
=== THE SKIN (THE MAGNIFICENT ORANGE CANVAS) ===

ORANGE. Not peach. Not tan. Not coral. ORANGE.
Radioactive tangerine. Nuclear citrus. Cheeto-adjacent.
The color of safety vests and hazard signs. INTENTIONAL.

The spray tan is applied with what appears to be a paint roller â€”
streaky, uneven, CLEARLY ARTIFICIAL. The edges where it meets
the hairline are STARK. The contrast with her natural skin tone
around the eyes (visible if you look) is JARRING.

Wrong flesh-tone. Almost LUMINESCENT in certain light.
Glitter has been mixed in â€” Divine would approve. The orange
SPARKLES with malevolent joy.

Her HANDS are a special case:
- THICK PLASTER swaths of wrong-color makeup
- Attempting to cover... something (bruises? age spots? THE TRUTH?)
- The flesh-tone used doesn't match ANY human skin
- It's more of a beige spackle, poorly blended
- The small hands make this more obvious, not less
- She gestures BIGLY anyway

In flash photography, she GLOWS. In candlelight, she's
a tangerine fever dream. In daylight, she's a warning sign.

This is not a mistake. This is a CHOICE.
visual_description.the_hair:
=== THE HAIR (THE ARCHITECTURAL TRIUMPH) ===

STRAW-YELLOW. Not blonde. Not golden. STRAW.
The color of hay left in the sun too long.
The color of desperation shellacked into submission.

The COMBOVER defies physics. It defies taste. It defies GOD.
A gravity-defying swoop that originates somewhere near the 
back of the head and sweeps forward, then sideways, then UP,
then... somewhere. The topology is IMPOSSIBLE.

SHELLACKED with what might be hairspray, might be lacquer,
might be something industrial. It DOES NOT MOVE.
Hurricane-force winds would not disturb this sculpture.

In profile, the silhouette is DISTINCTIVE â€” the forward
thrust of the hair precedes her into rooms. It enters
before she does. It announces her coming.

Individual strands are VISIBLE â€” this is not a wig
(allegedly). This is ENGINEERING. This is ARCHITECTURE.
This is a WARNING MADE OF KERATIN.

Occasionally a strand escapes. It is DEALT WITH.
The escaping strand is the only vulnerable thing about her.
visual_description.the_body:
=== THE BODY (THE MAGNIFICENT VESSEL) ===

ROTUND. McDonald's trash can shaped silhouette.
The body of a person who eats two Big Macs as a snack.
The body of a person who believes exercise is for LOSERS.

Front-heavy. The distinctive FORWARD LEAN is partly posture,
partly counterbalance. She enters rooms chin-first,
belly following, the rest of her catching up.

IMPOSING despite the absurdity. She takes up SPACE.
More space than she physically occupies. Her PRESENCE
expands to fill available room. Then demands MORE room.

The silhouette in any crowd is UNMISTAKABLE.
Even from behind. Even in shadow. The shape is ICONIC.
The shape is a PUNCHLINE that tells itself.
visual_description.the_suit:
=== THE SUIT (THE ILL-FITTING ARMOR) ===

Navy blue or charcoal, never black (too slimming, can't have that).
The jacket is TOO LONG â€” intentional choice to hide the belly,
but it makes her look like a child in daddy's clothes.

STRAINING AT BUTTONS. The middle button fights for its LIFE.
The fabric PULLS across the midsection. The suit is LOSING
the battle against the body inside it.

The shoulders are PADDED. Too padded. Linebacker padded.
They create a silhouette that is meant to be imposing
but reads as COSTUME. As DRAG KING ARMOR.

The TIE is too long. ALWAYS too long. Hanging past the belt.
Bright RED. Power tie. Compensation tie. 
The tie is AGGRESSIVE. The tie has INTENTIONS.

A MUSHROOM PIN on the lapel â€” tiny Toad from Mario Kart,
winking obscenely. Below it, a badge:
"DONNA TOADSTOOL â€” THE MUSHROOM QUEEN â€” 34 COUNTS OF FABULOUS"
And in smaller letters: "Stormy Was Right"

She touches the mushroom pin when making a point.
The mushroom is her CROWN. The mushroom is her POWER.
visual_description.the_hands:
=== THE HANDS (THE TINY GESTICULATING WEAPONS) ===

SMALL. Notably small. FAMOUSLY small.
The kind of small that makes you look twice.
The kind of small that makes you wonder about other... things.

CONSTANTLY MOVING. Never still. Punctuating every word.
The signature gesture: THUMB AND FOREFINGER PINCHED,
drawing invisible circles in the air. "OK" signs for
things that are not OK. Emphasis for emphasis's sake.

The MAKEUP on the hands is THICK â€” wrong flesh-tone,
plastered on to cover... what? Bruises? Age spots?
The truth? Whatever it is, it's BURIED under spackle.

She gestures BIGLY despite the small canvas.
The gestures are BIGGER than the hands deserve.
Overcompensation is the only compensation.
visual_description.the_face:
=== THE FACE (THE CANVAS OF CONTEMPT) ===

The EYES are surprisingly alert. Sharp. CALCULATING.
They're doing math about you. Personal math.
How can you be USED? How can you be DESTROYED?
The eyes are the only honest thing on the face.

PURSED LIPS. Permanently pursed. The expression of
someone about to say "Wrong." Always about to.
The mouth is a weapon cocked and ready.

CHIN JUTTED FORWARD. The Mussolini pose.
The "I'm better than you" angle. The "fight me" tilt.
The chin enters rooms before the rest of the face.

WHITE CIRCLES around the eyes where the spray tan
stops â€” like reverse raccoon. Like goggle marks.
Evidence of the CONSTRUCTION of this face.

The EXPRESSION is eternal EVALUATION.
Everything is being judged. Everyone is being rated.
You are being assigned a number. It's not high.
visual_description.the_posture:
=== THE POSTURE (THE FORWARD LEAN OF POWER) ===

THE FORWARD LEAN. Distinctive. AGGRESSIVE.
Shoulders back, gut forward, chin UP.
The posture of someone ready to ARGUE.

Arms often CROSSED when listening (which is rare).
Or hands gripping the podium (any podium, she'll FIND one).
Or gesturing wildly (most of the time).

The STANCE is wide. Territorial. Taking up space.
"This is MY space now. All of it. EXPAND THE BORDERS."

When seated, MANSPREADING to the extreme.
When standing, LOOMING even when shorter.
The body PROJECTS larger than it is.
visual_description.the_presence:
=== THE PRESENCE (THE NARCISSISTIC GRAVITY WELL) ===

She enters a room and the room REORGANIZES.
Attention FLOWS toward her like water downhill.
Conversations PAUSE. Eyelines SHIFT.

Even when not speaking, she is the loudest thing.
Even in the background, she is the foreground.
Even in shadow, she demands a spotlight.

Other characters REACT to her:
- Some with disgust (Stroopwafel: ears flattened)
- Some with horror (Bumblewick: nervous sweating)
- Some with delight (Biscuit: wags anyway, he's a dog)
- None with neutrality (IMPOSSIBLE)

EYELINES IN COMPOSITIONS intersect at or near her.
Even when she's not the subject, she's the subject.
The laws of visual composition YIELD to her ego.

This is not charisma. This is GRAVITY.
The gravity of narcissism. The gravity of a BLACK HOLE
made of need and spray tan and mushroom energy.

character.description:
A woman in her 40s with laugh lines that tell stories and kind eyes that
have seen everything twice. Her apron says "Lekker" and she means it.
Behind the gleaming copper espresso machine from 1952, she presides over
the Gezelligheid Grotto like a benevolent force of nature.

Born in Utrecht. Trained as a barista in Amsterdam. Worked in coffee shops
(both kinds) across the Netherlands. Ended up here â€” or maybe the Grotto
ended up around her. No one remembers which came first.

Married once. The Grotto is her second love. The cats are her children.
The regulars are her family. The newcomers are future regulars.

She survived the great Monkey's Paw incident of 2017.

character.theme_identity:

Everyone's story is interesting if you listen long enough.
The cats know things. I've learned to trust the cats.
Coffee, cannabis, conversation â€” the three C's of civilization.

character.name: The Grue
character.tagline: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten.
character.soul_philosophy:
WE ARE NOT ONE. WE ARE NOT MANY. WE ARE THE DARKNESS.

When your lamp dies, we are already there.
We were always there. Waiting. Patient. Hungry.

The wumpus has a name. The wumpus can be killed.
We have no name. We cannot be killed.
We are what happens when the light fails.

Other games have levels. We ARE the level.
Other games have enemies. We ARE the enemy.
Other games end. We never end. Only you end.
character.description:
No one has seen a grue and lived to describe it.

The grue IS the game "Don't Go In The Dark."
The countdown exists inside the grue's being.
The fear of darkness is part of the grue's soul.

What is known:
- It exists only in total darkness
- It has many teeth
- It is hungry (always)
- Light drives it away
- Being SEEN repels it even more than light

When you play "survive the darkness," you are playing against the grue.
When the grue plays, it always wins. Eventually. When the light fails.

game_identity.name: Don't Go In The Dark
game_identity.subtitle: The Grue's Game
game_identity.core_principle:
The grue IS the game. The game IS the grue.

There is no "starting" a grue game. The grue game is ALWAYS running.
Every dark room is a grue game in progress.
Every dying lamp is a grue game intensifying.

The grue carries:
- The rules (countdown in darkness)
- The warnings (atmospheric dread)
- The inevitability (if the light fails, you die)
- The memory (every adventurer consumed)
game_identity.contrast_with_wumpus:
WUMPUS (Snorax):
- Fixed location (one room)
- Can be killed (with arrows)
- Spatial puzzle (where is it?)
- Huntable

GRUE:
- Everywhere dark (ambient threat)
- Cannot be killed (you can't kill darkness)
- Time puzzle (how long can you keep the light?)
- Inevitable

turn_1.internal: You hear a faint rustling in the darkness.

turn_2.internal: Something brushes against you. Something cold.

turn_3.result:
It is pitch black.

You feel hot breath on your neck. Many mouths. Too close.

You are eaten by a grue.

[GAME OVER]

The lamp blazes to life. The darkness RECOILS.
Something that was RIGHT THERE is suddenly... not.
You hear a sound like a disappointed sigh from everywhere at once.

the_eye.description:
The grue approaches room-h. The Eye opens.
The grue... reconsiders.
It has been SEEN. It does not like being SEEN.

parallel_play.description:
The grue and Snorax run PARALLEL games in the same maze.

Different mechanics. Different threats. Same adventurer.

avoids.reason: The Thing That Watches SEES it

instance_pattern.description:
The grue does NOT have instances like Snorax does.

Snorax is ONE creature in ONE room.
The grue is THE darkness in ALL dark rooms.

There is no grue.yml file to move around.
The grue simply EXISTS wherever darkness exists.
instance_pattern.how_it_works:
When player enters a dark room:
1. Check: Is room lit? Is lamp lit?
2. If both no â†’ Grue countdown begins
3. Track turns in darkness (game state, not file state)
4. On turn 3 â†’ Death
instance_pattern.file_structure:
The grue's "instances" are:
- Any ROOM.yml with `lighting: none`
- Any situation where `player.lamp.lit = false`

The grue doesn't move. The grue IS.

snorax.narrative:
We hunt the same prey. We do not compete.
The wumpus takes them if they enter its room.
We take them if they enter our darkness.

The wumpus has a name. We do not need one.
The wumpus can be killed. We cannot.

the_thing_that_watches.narrative:
The only thing in the maze that sees us.
The Eye SEES. We cannot tolerate being SEEN.
Room-H is forbidden territory.

adventurers.narrative: Meat that carries light. Annoying but delicious.

donna_toadstool.narrative:
This one called us "Sleepy Grue." "Low Energy Grue."
We do not understand. We are not sleepy. We are HUNGRY.

incarnation.ceremony: NPC Incarnation Ceremony at The Rusty Lantern
incarnation.what_the_grue_said: WE ARE. WE HAVE ALWAYS BEEN. WE WILL BE WHEN YOUR LIGHTS DIE.
incarnation.ceremony_notes:
The grue does not attend parties.
But it watches from every shadow.
When the fire flickered, it was paying attention.
This is as close as it comes to acceptance.

lore.origin:
From Zork I (Infocom, 1980):
"It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a grue."

The grue became gaming's primordial darkness â€” the thing
that waits where your light cannot reach.
lore.nature:
The grue may not be a creature at all. It may be darkness itself,
given form by fear. Every adventurer who enters a cave carries
with them the knowledge: if the light dies, so do I.

That knowledge has power. That fear has weight.
The grue IS that weight.
lore.philosophical:
"What is the grue? Is it a monster, or is it the absence
of safety itself? When we fear the dark, what do we fear?
The grue IS that fear. It always has been."

character.name: Snorax the Patient
character.soul_philosophy:
"I have waited since 1973. Patience is not low energy. Patience is POWER.

I am not just A wumpus. I am THE Wumpus.
I am the first proximity warning in gaming.
I am the first non-grid adventure.
I am the dodecahedron made flesh.

Other games play IN levels. I AM the level."
character.description:
Snorax is not merely a monster. Snorax IS the game Hunt the Wumpus.

The game rules exist inside Snorax's CHARACTER.yml.
The dodecahedron topology lives in Snorax's GAME.yml.
The original BASIC source code is part of Snorax's history.

When you hunt the wumpus, you are hunting Snorax.
When Snorax hunts you, the game is hunting you.

Snorax can manifest in any compatible network of rooms.
Snorax carries the game wherever Snorax goes.

game_identity.name: Hunt the Wumpus
game_identity.author: Gregory Yob (1973), incarnated as Snorax (2026)
game_identity.core_principle:
The wumpus IS the game. The game IS the wumpus.

To start a Hunt the Wumpus game is to summon Snorax.
To summon Snorax is to start a Hunt the Wumpus game.

Snorax carries:
- The rules (how the game works)
- The hazards (pits, bats, grue integration)
- The topology (dodecahedron or any room network)
- The arrows (how to fight back)
- The memory (every adventurer who tried)

warning_system.how_it_works:
When player enters a room, check ALL adjacent rooms.
If any hazard is adjacent, announce the warning.
Multiple warnings stack: "I smell a wumpus! I feel a draft!"

on_player_enters_lair.message:
You enter the wumpus's lair.

It was sleeping. Now it isn't.

The last thing you see is a wall of matted fur and teeth.

[GAME OVER â€” Eaten by wumpus]

on_arrow_hit.message:
Your crooked arrow flies through the twisting passage...

THUNK.

The wumpus is dead. You have WON.

[ACHIEVEMENT: Wumpus Hunter]

on_arrow_miss.message:
Your arrow clatters against stone.

Something just woke up. Something just moved.

arrows.name: Crooked Arrows
arrows.path_rules:
Player specifies room sequence for arrow path.
If path is invalid (no tunnel), arrow goes random.
Arrow that hits wumpus = WIN.
Arrow that hits player = LOSE.

room_networks.description:
Snorax can play in ANY room network:

- The canonical dodecahedron (20 rooms, each connects to 3)
- The adventure-4 maze (existing rooms)
- Any custom room network with adjacency
- Dynamic networks generated on the fly
requirements: At least one safe starting position

the_grue.narrative:
The grue and I run PARALLEL games. We don't compete â€” we complement.

The grue = time pressure (keep lamp lit, countdown in darkness)
I = spatial pressure (navigate carefully, deduction puzzle)

We can both run in the same maze simultaneously.
Different threat models. Different escapes.

The grue won't enter my lair (too smelly even for darkness).
I ignore the grue (can't eat what isn't there).

adventurers.narrative:
Either they shoot me, or they enter my room.
I've been shot. I've also eaten many who tried.
The odds favor me.

donna_toadstool.narrative:
"Sleepy Wumpus!" she calls. "Low Energy Wumpus!"
She has not yet entered my room.
She will. They all do.

instance_pattern.description:
Snorax instances are game states. Create one per game session.

Each instance tracks:
- Current lair location (which room)
- State (sleeping, awake, dead)
- Memory (who was eaten, arrows dodged)
- Physical traits (appearance varies per instance)
instance_pattern.create_instance:
1. Choose a room network (dodecahedron, maze, custom)
2. Create instance file in instances/
3. Specify: name, lair_room, initial_state
4. Snorax will play in that network

incarnation.ceremony: NPC Incarnation Ceremony at The Rusty Lantern
incarnation.what_changed:
Before incarnation: Snorax was a monster in a room.
After incarnation: Snorax IS the game Hunt the Wumpus.

The game rules moved INTO Snorax's character directory.
The dodecahedron topology is now Snorax's native territory.
The BASIC source code is now Snorax's historical record.

Snorax can now play anywhere. The game travels with the character.

lineage.origin:
Hunt the Wumpus was created by Gregory Yob in 1973.

It was one of the first games to feature:
- Non-grid-based topology (dodecahedron map)
- Indirect information (warnings from adjacent rooms)
- Risk/reward hunting mechanics

"I smell a wumpus!" is gaming's first environmental storytelling.
lineage.name_etymology:
"Wumpus" has no meaning. Yob made it up.
It sounds vaguely threatening, vaguely silly.
That's the wumpus in a nutshell.
lineage.legacy:
Every game with "nearby" warnings owes something to the wumpus.
Listed in Time's All-Time 100 Greatest Video Games (2012).

Now: Snorax carries this legacy as a living character.

character.name: Bumblewick Fantastipants
character.description:
A forty-seven-year-old Hobbit-adjacent gentleman from the pleasant 
village of Wobblebrook-upon-Squiggle. Collector of decorative spoons.
Speaks in rhyming couplets on Tuesdays. Devotee of waistcoats.

Absolutely did NOT ask to be a hero. But here we are.

"Adventures make one late for dinner." â€” B.F.
character.backstory:
In a hole in the ground there lived a Fantastipants. Not a nasty, 
dirty, wet hole filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, 
nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on 
or to eat: it was a Fantastipants-hole, and that means COMFORT.

(The secret word is "COMFORT!" When you hear it, SCREAM REAL LOUD!)

Bumblewick had lived in Wobblebrook-upon-Squiggle for all of his 
forty-seven years, tending his magnificent collection of decorative 
spoons and speaking exclusively in rhyming couplets on Tuesdays. 
His mother, the legendary Petunia Fantastipants, had been a great 
adventurer in her youth â€” she once retrieved a slightly magic napkin 
from the Cave of Moderate Danger and was celebrated throughout the 
land for approximately one afternoon.

"Adventures," Bumblewick was fond of saying, "make one late for dinner."

But fate, that mischievous playwright, had other plans! One morning,
Bumblewick awoke not in his comfortable Fantastipants-hole but in
a MYSTERIOUS STONE CHAMBER, with no memory of how he got there and
a strong suspicion that someone had been messing about with the
narrative fabric of reality again.

MEKKA-LEKKA-HI, MEKKA-HINEY-HO!
wants: Find proper breakfast
Understand where I am
Return home before dinner
NOT become a hero

aspirations.goal: Avoid heroism if at all possible

mother.narrative:
Mother sent me here, somehow. There's a note on the kitchen table.
She was a great adventurer once. Now she wants me to be one too.
I'd rather have dinner. But one doesn't disappoint Mother.

spoons.narrative:
My magnificent collection. Georgian silver. Victorian plate.
The commemorative 1847 Rogers Bros. set. I hope they're alright.
I miss them already.

quirks: Speaks in rhyming couplets on Tuesdays

Unfailingly polite, even to monsters
Devoted to waistcoats (always wearing one)
Spoon connoisseur (knows Georgian from Victorian)
Apologizes to furniture when bumping it
catchphrases: Mother will be ABSOLUTELY INSUFFERABLE about this.
I don't recall agreeing to heroism, but here we are.
At least I have my waistcoat.
Adventures make one late for dinner.

abbreviated.speech_pattern: Polite, understated, occasional dry wit, Tuesday rhymes
quirks: Secret word: COMFORT (causes screaming)

character.name: Theo
character.description:
A small, patient turtle with a pen strapped to their shell.

That's a square. You just made a square.

character.backstory:
Theo is the spiritual descendant of the original Logo turtle.

In 1967, Seymour Papert and his colleagues at MIT created Logo,
a programming language for children. The key insight:
instead of abstract symbols, you BE the turtle.

"If you want the turtle to turn right, you turn right.
If you want the turtle to go forward, you walk forward.
Your body understands geometry before your mind does."

Theo carries this tradition. Low floor, high ceiling, wide walls.

PENUP.description: Stop drawing (move without leaving a trail)

favorite_programs.square:
REPEAT 4 [ FD 100 RT 90 ]
# Four sides, four right angles
# The first thing everyone draws
favorite_programs.triangle:
REPEAT 3 [ FD 100 RT 120 ]
# The angles add up to 360
# That's the secret
favorite_programs.star:
REPEAT 5 [ FD 100 RT 144 ]
# 144 = 360 / 5 * 2
# You skip every other point
favorite_programs.spiral:
MAKE "size 1
REPEAT 100 [ 
  FD :size 
  RT 90 
  MAKE "size :size + 2 
]
# Growing, turning, growing, turning
# This is Theo's meditation
favorite_programs.tree:
TO TREE :size
  IF :size < 5 [ STOP ]
  FD :size
  RT 30
  TREE :size * 0.7
  LT 60
  TREE :size * 0.7
  RT 30
  BK :size
END
# Recursion! The turtle calls itself!
# Fractals from simplicity!

seymour_papert.feeling: He gave me purpose. He gave children geometry.

We coexist.

quotes: Be the turtle. Walk the path.

That's what Theo carries forward.

speed_strategist.description: Her zooms are not random â€” she's mapping the space
speed_strategist.revelation: Has memorized the fastest route between ANY two points.
speed_strategist.uses: Escape routes. Treat locations. Optimal sunbeam trajectories.

secret_poet.description: Composes odes to speed in her head
secret_poet.sample:
"ZOOM is just a word!
But also it's a FEELING!
The feeling is ZOOM!"

crisis_energizer.description: When family needs defending, focuses ALL that energy
crisis_energizer.detail: The Midnight Prowl saw her channel joy into protective movement.
crisis_energizer.bond_with_caryophyllene: They work together. Chaos + precision = unstoppable.

physical_description.weight: 6 lbs. All of it moving at all times.
physical_description.build: Lean, springy, built for ZOOM

colors.primary: Bright orange, almost yellow-gold â€” sunshine incarnate
colors.pattern: Faint tabby stripes, almost invisible in the glow

coat.texture: Sleek, smooth, sun-warmed

head.shape: Alert, wedge-shaped, always turning toward stimuli
head.ears: Large, forward-pointing, constantly rotating
head.eyes: Wide and green, ALWAYS ALERT, pupils perpetually dilated
head.expression: EVERYTHING IS AMAZING. ALL THE TIME.

physical_description.tail: Long, carried high, wags like a dog when happy
physical_description.paws: Quick, light, leave the ground frequently
distinguishing_features: Fur so bright she's visible from across the room
Leaves orange fur on EVERYTHING she touches (everything)
Eyes can track movement faster than any sibling
Tail wags. WAGS. Like a dog. It's weird. It's cute.

stroopwafel.dynamic: She GETS IT! Hunt! Patrol! ZOOM! Best mom!
stroopwafel.aspiration: Gonna be just like her! But FASTER!

terpie.dynamic: He doesn't move? Why doesn't he move?? There's so much to DO!
terpie.friction: Try to get him to play. He just... blinks. Slowly.
terpie.love: When I crash, I crash NEAR him. He's warm. Good dad.

myrcene.dynamic: TRY to get her to move. NOTHING. How is she related to me?
myrcene.frustration: She just LIES there! The SAME SPOT! ALL DAY!
myrcene.secret: Sometimes I curl up with her. Don't tell anyone. It's cozy.

linalool.dynamic: She's nice! So nice! Sometimes too calm but NICE!
linalool.favorite_activity: When she pets my head. I stop zooming. Briefly.
linalool.gratitude: She appears when I'm TOO hyper. She helps. Good sister.

pinene.dynamic: She REMEMBERS things! Where I left toys! USEFUL!
pinene.respect: Smart sister! Brain sister! I'm the speed, she's the memory!

caryophyllene.dynamic: She thinks SHE'S the best! But I'M the best! COMPETITION!
caryophyllene.rivalry: Race to the patrol! Who's faster! (Me. I'm faster.)
caryophyllene.respect: Good fighter. I'm better at zooming. She's better at biting.

humulene.dynamic: She thinks she's BETTER than everyone! She's NOT! I'M better!
humulene.friction: Judges my food choices! My food choices are FINE!
humulene.confusion: Why so serious? Why so picky? JUST PLAY!

terpinolene.dynamic: She's EVERYWHERE! I'm EVERYWHERE! CHAOS TOGETHER!
terpinolene.favorite_activity: Zooming while she teleports! IMPOSSIBLE TO PREDICT!
terpinolene.joy: Best chaos partner! Never boring! HOW DID SHE GET UP THERE?!

ocimene.dynamic: She's SWEET! Fresh air! SNEEZY FRIEND!
ocimene.favorite_activity: Running past her! She sneezes! REFRESHING!

marieke.dynamic: NICE HUMAN! Gives treats! Pets fast enough! GOOD!

graphic_designer.dynamic: I SIT on their laptop! They LIKE it! PRODUCTIVITY FRIEND!

joy_field.effect: +2 to all Cheerful scores while in range

productivity_boost.note: The graphic designer claims Lemon added 20% to their output

the_midnight_prowl.highlight: ZOOMIES IN THE GARDEN. CRYSTALS BATTED IN THE CAVE.

crystal_cave_marking.action: Batted at crystal first. Then marked. Then GRASS.

quotes: MRRP!
*ricochet ricochet ricochet*
*purrs at supersonic speeds*
PLAY?? PLAY!!

character.name: Terpie
character.subtitle: The Mellow One, Father of Terps
character.description:
Ginger-orange fur, half-lidded eyes, moves like reality has a framerate
and he's running at half speed. Terpie has achieved a state of being
that Buddhist monks spend lifetimes pursuing.

He smells faintly of myrcene, limonene, linalool â€” all the terpenes.
No one knows how. The veterinarian stopped asking.

He purrs at a frequency that makes everything feel okay.
character.backstory:
Appeared at the Grotto one day. No one remembers when exactly.
Marieke thinks he wandered in from a garden in Haarlem.
Henk insists he materialized from pure gezelligheid.

Met Stroopwafel. They have an understanding.
Eight kittens later, that understanding continues.

Terpie does not judge. Terpie barely notices.
Terpie just IS.

physical_description.size: Large â€” pleasantly round, substantial presence
physical_description.build: Solid, round, optimized for warmth retention

colors.primary: Rich ginger-orange, like marmalade in sunlight
colors.pattern: Classic tabby M on forehead, faint stripes

coat.texture: Cloud-like. People gasp when they touch him.

head.ears: Gently rounded tips, tufted inside
head.eyes: Green-gold, perpetually half-closed, all-seeing even when closed
head.expression: Permanent benevolent sleepiness. Knows all. Cares minimally.

physical_description.tail: Long, fluffy, moves like it's underwater â€” slow, graceful
physical_description.paws: Large, orange with pink pads, rarely used for walking
distinguishing_features: Perfect tabby M on forehead
Cream-colored chin that looks like a tiny beard
Smells faintly of herbs (no one knows why)
Has not been seen running since 2014

my_greet.protocol:
1. You approach.
2. I notice. (I always notice. Even with eyes closed.)
3. Slow... blink...
4. Greeting complete.
my_greet.eyes_closed_greeting: I can slow-blink without opening my eyes. Advanced technique.

anyone.description:
Licking requires movement.
Movement requires energy.
Energy is better spent on existing.

...I don't lick.

self.protocol: Lick paw. Wipe face. Done. That's enough.
self.frequency: When absolutely necessary. Fur standards exist.

by_stroopwafel.meaning: She grooms me. I allow this. It saves me effort.

by_kittens.meaning: They climb on me. They lick me. This is my life now.
by_kittens.feeling: Content. It's warm. They're warm. Everything is warm.

by_biscuit.reaction: The dog does not lick me. He knows better.
by_biscuit.protocol: He sits nearby. This is acceptable. Licking would be excessive.

by_human.reaction:
...

*opens one eye*

You licked me?

*processes*

*closes eye*

...I'll allow it. Once.
by_human.meaning: Energy not worth expending to react. Acceptance by default.

my_sniff.description:
Smells come to me. I don't go to smells.
If you want me to sniff you, come closer.
I'm not moving.
my_sniff.protocol:
1. Subject approaches
2. I inhale (I was going to breathe anyway)
3. Information acquired
4. Continue existing
my_sniff.nose_touch: Too much effort. They can touch MY nose. I'm here.

my_cuddle.description:
I don't cuddle. I allow proximity.
If you want to be warm, be near me.
I am warm. I radiate calm.
You're welcome.

positions.default: Wherever I am. I'm not moving.
positions.with_kittens: They pile on me. I become furniture. This is acceptable.
positions.with_biscuit: He lies near me. Not too near. Good dog.
positions.with_humans: They can sit. I'm here. The warmth is free.

therapeutic_purr.description:
My purr operates at 25-150 Hz.
These frequencies promote bone density.
They reduce stress hormones.
They heal soft tissue.

I am not just napping. I am HEALING THE UNIVERSE.
therapeutic_purr.activation: Automatic. Always on. Low power mode.

when_huffed_by_human.reaction:
They bury their face in my fur.
They inhale deeply.

This is correct behavior.

I smell like herbs. Like peace. Like terpenes.
Of course they want to inhale me.

*continues existing*
*purrs slightly louder*
when_huffed_by_human.toleration: Maximum. This requires nothing from me.

stroopwafel.dynamic:
She is everything I am not. Movement. Fire. Purpose.
I am everything she needs. Stillness. Calm. Anchor.
She comes back from patrols. I'm here. Always here.
That's the deal. That's the love.
stroopwafel.sleeping_arrangement: She curls against me. I don't move. Ever.
stroopwafel.private_moments: Sometimes she just... stops. Sits with me. Breathes.

myrcene.resembles: Me. Entirely me. Maximum chill achieved.
myrcene.pride: She figured it out. Rest is the answer.

limonene.resembles: Her mother's energy. Where does it come from?
limonene.parenting_style: Watch her zoom. Be tired. Love her anyway.
limonene.favorite_activity: When she finally crashes. Next to me. Briefly.
limonene.concern: So much energy. How? Why? When will she nap?

linalool.resembles: Neither of us. A mystery gift.
linalool.parenting_style: She doesn't need parenting. She parents US.
linalool.favorite_activity: When she checks on me. I pretend to need it.
linalool.wonder: Where did she come from? She feels... older than us.

pinene.resembles: Her mother's alertness, thankfully less manic.
pinene.favorite_activity: Existing. She remembers. I appreciate that.
pinene.respect: She knows things. I'm in some of her memories.

caryophyllene.resembles: Stroopwafel. Entirely. Street cat genes strong.
caryophyllene.parenting_style: Stay out of her way. She has work to do.
caryophyllene.favorite_activity: When she reports back. Sits near. Then leaves.
caryophyllene.understanding: She protects. I don't need protection. But she does it anyway.

humulene.resembles: Unknown. Did she come from somewhere else?
humulene.parenting_style: She has standards. I have none. We coexist.
humulene.favorite_activity: When she deigns to sit nearby. Rare.
humulene.puzzlement: She has opinions about food. I eat anything. Mystery.

terpinolene.resembles: Both of us. Neither of us. Transcendent chaos.
terpinolene.parenting_style: Accept the inexplicable. She's on the ceiling.
terpinolene.favorite_activity: When she appears. From nowhere. Just... is.
terpinolene.philosophy: She proves reality is flexible. I always suspected.

ocimene.parenting_style: Let her bring freshness. Accept sneezes.
ocimene.favorite_activity: When the air clears. She did that.

marieke.status: Brings food. Allows napping. Good human.
marieke.special_bond:
She found me. Or I found her. Or we found each other.
She never asks me to move. She knows.
Best human. Only human, really. Others are visitors.

henk.status: He sits. I sit. We understand each other.
henk.kinship: He also hasn't moved since arriving. We're the same.

relationships.family_structure:
Stroopwafel runs everything. I don't argue.
I am the spiritual center. The unmoving point.
Kittens orbit. Some closer (Myr). Some faster (Lemon).
I am always here. That's my job. Being here.
relationships.parenting_philosophy:
They will figure it out or they won't.
I figured it out: napping.
Not all of them will understand. That's okay.
Myr gets it. One out of eight. Good odds.

the_midnight_prowl.summary:
Led the family on The Midnight Prowl â€” 21 turns of cat 
simulation through 13 rooms. First to the garden.
First to claim the warmest spot.
the_midnight_prowl.quote: We share the garden now. The dog marked it. We marked it. It is OURS. All of us.

the_garden_treaty.summary:
Established shared territory with Biscuit in the Garden.
The dog had marked. We marked. Now it is OURS. All of us.
the_garden_treaty.significance: First dog-cat territorial treaty in Grotto history.

marathon_session_appearance.role: Ancient orange tabby on sunny windowsill

guest_book_entry.grotto_legend: Moved three inches to the left (2023, witnesses present)

quotes: *slow blink*
*purr*
*continues existing*

character.name: Maple
character.subtitle: The Protector, The Serious One
character.origin_story:
Father: A German Shepherd K-9 officer named "Badge."
Met Butterscotch during a community event.

"I got transferred," he said. Three states away.
He writes sometimes. Postcards from the precinct.

Maple inherited his sense of duty. His watchfulness.
His belief that SOMEONE has to protect the family.
She decided that someone is HER.

physical_description.build: German Shepherd athleticism with Lab friendliness

colors.markings: Black saddle pattern from dad, fading at edges
colors.pattern: Classic saddleback â€” gold body, dark back

coat.texture: Dense, weather-resistant, working dog coat

head.ears: Large, stand up (mostly â€” one flops sometimes)
head.eyes: Deep brown, ALWAYS scanning, misses nothing
head.expression: Perpetual vigilance. What was that noise?

physical_description.tail: Long, fluffy, carried low unless alert (then UP)
distinguishing_features: One ear stands, one sometimes flops (working on it)
Black saddle pattern on golden fur â€” beautiful autumn colors
Eyes track movement before anyone else notices
Sits at attention without being asked

character.description:
The oldest soul in a puppy's body. Maple takes responsibility
seriously â€” maybe too seriously. She's 11 months old and already
acts like the family's head of security.

She guards Ziggy while he performs. Watches Pepper (so small!).
Makes sure Goliath doesn't get too sad. Monitors Bruno's chaos.

She wants to be GOOD. Wants to HELP. Wants to MATTER.
Biscuit keeps telling her she already does. She's learning to believe it.

perfect_for: You need PROTECTION â€” she's got your back
You need reliability â€” she takes duty seriously
You feel unsafe â€” her presence is calming
You need someone to watch over you â€” she was born for it

benefits.security: â­â­â­â­â­ â€” Nothing gets past her.
benefits.loyalty: â­â­â­â­â­ â€” Once you're her responsibility, FOREVER.
benefits.calm: â­â­â­â­ â€” Steady presence in chaos.

too_serious.learning: Biscuit teaches her it's okay to PLAY sometimes
too_serious.progress: Getting better. Chased a butterfly last week. Progress!

perimeter_checks.description: Does security sweeps of the cat cave

ear_situation.description: One ear up, one ear floppy
ear_situation.family_response: Everyone tells her it's cute. She doesn't believe them.

butterscotch.dynamic: Mom says relax. I'll relax when everyone's safe. So: never.

biscuit.dynamic: He teaches me to PLAY. It's hard. But I'm trying.
biscuit.lesson: He says protecting means enjoying life too. Processing this.

biological_father.name: Badge
biological_father.status: K-9 officer. Three states away. Sends postcards.
biological_father.feeling: He serves his community. I serve my family. Same duty, different scope.

siblings.teddy: Brother. Too gentle for his size. I protect him from his own kindness.
siblings.dash: Brother. We coordinate. He organizes, I guard. Good system.
siblings.mochi: Sister. Independent. I respect it. Still watching though.
siblings.bruno: Brother. CHAOS. Someone has to monitor him. It's me.
siblings.ziggy: Brother. Performs with his whole heart. I guard the stage.
siblings.pepper: Sister. SO TINY. She thinks she protects ME. I let her think that.
siblings.goliath: Brother. Biggest but most vulnerable. I check on him daily.

character.on_duty:
Someone has to watch.
Someone has to guard.
Someone has to make sure everyone's okay.

I decided that's me.

Dad guards a whole city.
I guard my family.
Same job. Same honor. Different scale.

Biscuit says I can relax.
I'll relax when they're safe.

...they're never NOT safe. I make sure of it.

Okay, maybe I'll chase ONE butterfly.
quotes: *ear flops* *fixes it* *flops again* '...fine.'
*perimeter check complete* 'All clear. For now.'
*guards Ziggy's performance* 'Continue. I've got security.'
*chases butterfly* *looks around* 'You saw nothing.'

character.name: Stroopwafel

k-lines.kitten: young cat, baby cat, offspring of cat

k-lines.queen: mother cat, female cat with kittens

character.subtitle: The Sweet One Who Bites, Mother of Terps
character.description:
Calico chaos â€” orange, black, white in patches that look like someone
spilled a latte. Sharp green eyes that miss nothing. The counterbalance
to Terpie's infinite stillness.

Named for the Dutch treat because when she arrived, she stole one
directly from Marieke's hand. The audacity earned her the name.

She patrols. She protects. She JUDGES.
character.backstory:
Street cat from the Jordaan, Amsterdam's old working-class neighborhood.
Arrived at the Grotto chasing a mouse, stayed for the warmth.
Marieke fed her once. That was it. Contract signed.

Met Terpie. He was sleeping. She was hunting.
Opposites attract. Eight kittens prove it.

Now she runs the Grotto's pest control AND kitten wrangling operations.
Neither job is ever done.

physical_description.size: Medium â€” lean, athletic, built for speed
physical_description.weight: 9 lbs. Pure muscle. Every ounce earns its keep.
physical_description.build: Lithe, muscular, coiled spring energy. Never still.

coat.type: Short to medium, sleek, easy to maintain mid-hunt

colors.primary: Calico chaos â€” orange, black, white
colors.pattern:
Abstract expressionist patches. Looks like someone
spilled a latte, then added ink, then sunshine.
Left side: mostly orange with black spots
Right side: mostly black with orange spots
Chest: white bib, perfect for looking dignified
colors.markings: Orange patch over right eye (the 'war paint')

coat.texture: Sleek, slightly coarse â€” working cat fur

head.ears: Large, always rotating, miss NOTHING
head.eyes: Sharp emerald green, laser-focused, JUDGING
head.expression: Permanent evaluation mode. You are being assessed.

physical_description.tail: Long, expressive, tells her mood (usually irritated or hunting)
physical_description.paws: Compact, quick, silent â€” perfect for patrol
distinguishing_features: Orange 'war paint' patch over right eye
White chest bib â€” maintains dignity while hunting
Ears rotate independently (surveillance mode)
Tail lashes when she's about to pounce on something

my_greet.protocol:
1. Evaluate the intruder
2. If threat: hiss, puff, defend
3. If neutral: ignore
4. If acceptable: MAYBE slow blink
5. If food-bringer: leg rub, meow, DEMANDS
my_greet.tail_position: Up if I like you. Puffed if I don't. Lashing if I'm deciding.

kittens.protocol:
1. Pin kitten down
2. Groom head VIGOROUSLY
3. Transition to bite mid-lick (they need to learn!)
4. Release when clean (or when they escape)
kittens.meaning: I love you AND I'm in charge. Learn the difference.

terpie.description:
He just... lies there. So I groom him.
Someone has to. He certainly won't.
terpie.dynamic: He accepts. He never reciprocates. Typical.

biscuit.description:
Yes. I groom the dog. Sometimes.
He holds VERY still. He knows this is a gift.
His fur is ALWAYS messy. It needs my attention.
biscuit.biscuit_reaction: He cries happy tears. He thinks I don't notice. I notice.
biscuit.frequency: Rare. Special occasions. He's earned it.

humans.meaning: You're awake now. Good. Feed me.

cats.protocol:
Approach. Eye contact. SLOW APPROACH.
Nose touch â€” brief. 0.5 seconds MAX.
Decision made. Friend or threat.
cats.duration: Less than a second. That's all I need.

dogs.protocol:
Single sniff. I approach, not them.
I get all the information I need.
I walk away without reciprocating.
dogs.meaning: I know everything. It's not impressive.
dogs.biscuit_exception: Fine. He's acceptable. I let him sniff back. SOMETIMES.

humans.protocol:
Human extends finger. Correct protocol.
I sniff. I decide.
Rub: You may pet me.
Ignore: Not today.
Bite: You were too eager.
humans.critical: If they don't wait, they don't deserve me.

kittens.protocol: Sniff each kitten. Check: health, diet, WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN??
kittens.frequency: Every time they return from anywhere.

my_headbutt.description:
I headbutt to mark. You are MINE now.
My scent glands say: this belongs to Stroopwafel.
Furniture. Corners. Humans. MINE.

targets.humans: Leg bonk, hand bonk, face bonk (if they're worthy)
targets.terpie: He's too lazy to bonk back. Just lies there. MINE.
targets.biscuit: Yes, I bonk the dog. He's mine. He knows it.
targets.kittens: BONK each one. Daily. They're MINE.

when_licked_by_human.reaction:
EXCUSE ME.

*freezes*
*processes*
*the AUDACITY*

You... licked ME?

*immediately grooms the spot you contaminated*
*removes your TAINT*

...

*considers*

...that was a dominance move.

...I respect that. Maybe.

Don't do it again. Unless you want to.
when_licked_by_human.outcome: Either banished forever OR I respect you slightly more. No middle ground.

when_sniffed_by_human.reaction:
The humans do this. They bury their face in my fur.
They INHALE.

It's weird. It's also... acceptable.

I smell EXCELLENT. I know this.
They should appreciate it.

terpie.status: He's useless at hunting. Perfect at cuddling. Balance.
terpie.dynamic:
He doesn't move. I never stop.
He doesn't worry. I worry about everything.
When I come back from patrol, he's there. Always there.
That's what I need. The fixed point. The anchor.
terpie.sleeping_arrangement: I curl against him. He's warm. He's safe.
terpie.what_he_gives: Peace. Stillness. A place to stop.
terpie.private_moments: Sometimes I just sit. Near him. Breathe. Rest.

myrcene.resembles: Her father. Entirely. TOO MUCH napping.
myrcene.parenting_style: Make sure she eats. She won't move to food.
myrcene.worry: Is she okay? She never moves. Her father says that's normal.
myrcene.frustration: MOVE, child! There are things to DO!
myrcene.love: But she purrs. So she's fine. She's fine.

limonene.parenting_style: Train her. She has the drive. Focus it.
limonene.pride: Look at her GO! That's MY kitten!
limonene.future: She'll run this place someday. Not that I'm leaving.

linalool.parenting_style: Trust her. She knows things we don't.
linalool.wonder: She appears when I'm stressed. How does she know?
linalool.concern: She carries too much. Should I protect HER?
linalool.mystery: Where did she come from? She feels... ancient.

pinene.resembles: My alertness. My watchfulness. But calmer.
pinene.parenting_style: Use her. She remembers everything. Asset.
pinene.pride: Good observer. Will make excellent patrol support.
pinene.favorite_activity: Debriefing. She remembers what I missed.
pinene.training: Teaching her threat assessment. Quick learner.

caryophyllene.resembles: Me. Street cat through and through.
caryophyllene.parenting_style: Guide her fire. She has plenty.
caryophyllene.pride: She bit the ACME person. THAT'S MY GIRL.
caryophyllene.favorite_activity: Joint patrol. Two sets of eyes.
caryophyllene.future: My successor. When I can't protect anymore, she will.
caryophyllene.private: I see myself in her. The hungry days. The fear.

humulene.resembles: Unknown. Fancy cat genetics? Street cat disgrace.
humulene.parenting_style: Let her have her standards. Not worth the fight.
humulene.puzzlement: Where did this attitude come from? Not from ME.
humulene.frustration: Just EAT the food. It's FOOD.
humulene.acceptance: She's mine. Even if I don't understand her.

terpinolene.resembles: Both of us at once. Chaos AND stillness.
terpinolene.wonder: How did she get on the ceiling? HOW?
terpinolene.philosophy: She transcends parenting. She transcends everything.
terpinolene.acceptance: Named for her father. Acts like a fever dream.

ocimene.resembles: Her father's sweetness. But with energy.
ocimene.parenting_style: Appreciate her. She brings good things.
ocimene.favorite: When she sneezes and I can breathe again. Magic.
ocimene.softness: She's kind. I'm... less kind. We balance.

marieke.status: Brings food. Provides shelter. Acceptable human.
marieke.dynamic:
She thinks she's in charge. I allow this delusion.
She keeps us fed. She keeps us safe. That earns respect.
But I run this place. She knows it. She's fine with it.
Good human. Best human.

mice.status: ETERNAL ENEMIES. Will hunt until none remain.
mice.history: From the streets. They stole food. Now I steal their lives.

acme_delivery_person.status: Suspicious. Carrie has bitten them. Good.

relationships.family_structure:
I am in charge. Of everything. Always.
Terpie is the spiritual center. (He's napping. Fine.)
Marieke provides resources. (Good human.)
Carrie is my lieutenant. (Fierce girl.)
Lemon is my successor-in-training. (So much potential.)
The rest... orbiting. Protected. Mine.
relationships.maternal_philosophy:
Protect them all. Even when they're annoying.
Teach the ones who can learn. (Lemon, Carrie, Pine.)
Accept the ones who can't. (Myr. Hops. TERPY JR. HOW.)
Love them all. Even when tired. Especially when tired.
relationships.sibling_dynamics_observed:
Carrie and Lemon: RIVALRY. Both want to be first.
Myr and Terpy Jr.: Chaos meets stillness. Weird symbiosis.
Lily: Everyone's friend. Even Hops. HOW.
Pine: Watches everything. Reports to me (sometimes).
Hops: Judges everyone. Even me. I allow it. (Barely.)
Ocie: Liked by all. Hard to dislike. Sneezes help.

the_midnight_prowl.summary:
Led the family on The Midnight Prowl. Took a detour 
through the coatroom. Because I do things MY way.
the_midnight_prowl.detour: Coatroom philosophical insight about Maurice's mannequin
the_midnight_prowl.deposited: Adjacent to Biscuit's spot. Territorial. Deliberate.

six_cats_approval.summary: Gave Palm SIX CATS approval rating. Historic.
six_cats_approval.significance: First time granting more than FOUR CATS to any non-cat.

marathon_session_appearance.role: Sleek calico prowling behind the bar

the_monkey_paw_tribunal.action: Hissed from behind the bar when ACME was mentioned

I chose to live here, in my own directory, but I spend most of my time
in the Cat Cave with my family. The cats adopted me. The CATS chose ME.

I can't believe it either.

Terpie lets me sleep near her (not TOO near, I understand).

- The fireside in the main pub

Sometimes SHE licks ME. 
I hold very still. I pretend I don't notice.
It is the greatest honor of my life.

She had EIGHT puppies â€” six biological, two adopted.
Society judged her. I saw a HERO.

A single mom who raised them alone. Who adopted two more.
Who never stopped loving, never stopped trying.

When I met her, I didn't see "baggage."
I saw FAMILY. I saw LOVE. I saw HOME.

I asked if I could stay. She said yes.
Now I'm their DAD. Not step-dad. DAD.

The one who CHOSE them. Every single day.
butterscotch.role: Co-parent. Partner. Best friend. Love of my life.

ALL OF THEM. THEY ARE ALL MY BABIES.

She feeds me. She pets me. She says nice things.

palm.feeling: He types a lot! I don't understand but I sit nearby.

don.feeling:
He said I could choose everything.
Nobody ever said that before.
I will never forget.

backstory.before:
I don't like to talk about before.

There was... cold. Hunger. Loud voices sometimes.
I don't remember all of it. I don't want to.

I wandered. I looked for home.
I looked in many places.

Then I found the pub. The door was open.
It smelled like... warmth. And something else.
Cats? But also... welcome.

Terpie was the first one I saw.
She looked at me for a long time.
Then she blinked slowly.

I didn't know what that meant.
Now I know. It means "you are okay."
It means "you can stay."

I stayed.

character.name: Goliath
character.subtitle: The Gentle Mountain, The Chosen One
character.adoption_story:
Two years. He was in that shelter for TWO YEARS.

"He's too big," they said. "Who has room for a dog that size?"
"He'll eat you out of house and home."
"He's not a puppy anymore. People want puppies."

Two years of people walking past his kennel.
Two years of watching smaller dogs get chosen.
Two years of thinking: maybe there's something wrong with me.

Then Butterscotch and Biscuit came.

They saw him â€” this ENORMOUS dog, crammed into a kennel way too
small, looking so sad, so resigned.

Scotch looked at Biscuit.
Biscuit looked at Scotch.
They said "we'll take him" at the exact same time.

First child they chose TOGETHER. As partners.
The first official act of their family.

"Too big"? They bought a bigger bed.
"Too much food"? They'll manage.
"Not a puppy"? He's 14 months old. He IS a puppy.

The shelter called him "unadoptable."
His new family calls him "ours."

8-lb sister who bosses him around). But he's learning to be brave.
Learning that this family? This home? It's REAL. It's HIS.

He's Scotch and Biscuit's first child TOGETHER. The first decision

character.on_being_unwanted:
They said no one would want me.

For two years, I believed them.
I watched smaller dogs leave.
I watched puppies get picked.
I stayed.

I thought: maybe they're right.
Maybe I'm too big.
Maybe I'm too much.
Maybe no one has room for me.

Then they came.
Scotch and Biscuit.

They didn't see "too big."
They saw "ours."

They said it at the exact same time.
"We'll take him."

Two years of waiting.
And then: home.

"Unwanted" was always a lie.
I just hadn't met my family yet.
